sub_title: Sustainability Specialist | Marketing Professional | Social Enterprise Focus
summary:
I do purpose-driven work 🙂 Currently looking to assist impact driven organisation to scale up their business as a sustainability manager.

Over 10 years of experience as a development professional specializing in sustainability sector in Indonesia, Australia, Colombia, Nepal, Costa Rica with diverse types of clients (Government, NGOs, academic institutions, and start-up businesses). 

I am passionate about assisting businesses and organisations in bringing positive impact to the community through research, program design and implementation, partnership building, and exposure in public (marketing and PR).

I hold a double Master's Degree (Master of Environmental Management and Development and Master of Diplomacy) from The Australian National University and third Master Degree in Responsible Management & Sustainable Development from UN Mandated University for Peace, all under full scholarship.

I published 4 non-fiction books and one academic book with major publishers. In my spare time, I run a blog where I share my experience traveling to over 65 countries on 6 continents (www.travelingajadulu.com) and a podcast on sustainable business in Bali (www.livinginbalipodcast.com). Feel free to contact me for collaboration. 

Skills:

1. Project Management: 9+ years in designing, implementing and coordinating projects & programs.
2. Research & Writing: 5 book publications (3 co-authored), 2 accepted solo grant proposals each by USAID & AUSAID, and significant contributions for grant proposals and field/desktop research activities to diverse clients.
3. Event Organizing: 12+ years in organizing social & environmental impact projects.
4. Public Speaking: 10 + years in public speaking as a speaker, MC, and moderator. 

Specialities: development, sustainability, social impact.

awards.title: Asian Peacebuilders Scholarship Awards 16
awards.description: I am one among 30 recipients from Asian countries (Myanmar, The Philipines, Indonesia, Japan, Sri Lanka, Vietnam, and Thailand) who received fully funded scholarships to do a double Masters program in Universidad Para La Paz (Costa Rica) and Ateneo De Manila (The Philipines) for 18-22 months.

awards.title: 3rd Winner Seed Grant YSEALI Regional Gender
awards.description:
3rd place for seed grant competition in Brunei Darussalam for the proposed project "Women Economic Empowerment" with the amount $3.000. The event was organised by WEDU for YSEALI Regional Conference. 
The implementation took place in Jakarta and Bali.

awards.title: Asia Pacific Week ANU
awards.description: The Australian National University’s Asia Pacific Week is an interdisciplinary conference aimed at high-achieving students from around the world who have an interest in Asia and the Pacific. Bringing together 100 of the best students from across the globe, the 2016 conference continues the tradition of bringing together scholars, policymakers and senior officials of the highest calibre for a week of stimulating discussion and debate.

awards.title: Global Entrepreneurship Summit 2016
awards.description: The summit was held from June 22-24 in various locations on the Stanford campus. I was one of 700 selected entrepreneurs from 160 countries attended the event with around 5000 application received. I represented my social enterprise project "Youth Ecopreneurship Camp"
awards.issuer: Department of State US, White House and President Obama

awards.title: IARU Global University Climate Forum
awards.description: My team and I went to Paris to present our project, Youth Ecopreneruship Camp, at Sorbonne University. Our participation was supported by ANU Green, CCI, and Crawford School.

awards.title: MIKTA Young Professional Camp Delegate

awards.title: Hult Prize Shanghai Regional Finalist
awards.description: Team leader for ANU delegation for the  Hult Global Case Challenge Shanghai Regional Final, the world's largest case competition and crowdsourcing platform for social good. Successfully brought the team to enter the regional competition after competing 20.000 applicants from different universities in more than 150 countries.

awards.title: Australia Awards
awards.description: The Australia Awards are prestigious international scholarships and fellowships funded by the Australian Government. They offer the next generation of global leaders an opportunity to undertake study, research and professional development in Australia and for high-achieving Australians to do the same overseas.

projects.title: Asia Forum on Carbon Update
projects.description:
Asia Forum on Carbon Update (AFCU) is an annual forum among key stakeholders in Asian region aims at the following objectives:
•To share ideas and experiences on the implementation of low carbon economy by elaborating various technical/practical issues.
•To update the on-going initiatives and progresses on Asia’s mitigation actions to reduce GHG emission, particularly the most recent issues such as REDD+, MRV, climate financing and capacity building.
•To develop any potentials collaborative efforts among Asian countries in seeking a viable mechanisms in tackling climate change issues.

In 2012, AFCU was held from 15-17 February in Bandung.

projects.title: Indonesia Carbon Update
projects.description:
The Indonesia Carbon Update (ICU) 2011 is a continuation of previous meeting (ICU 2010) which aimed to share ideas, experiences and knowledge between the Government of Indonesia (GOI) and stake holders on mitigation issues, actions in Indonesia as well as stands on global negotiations.

In 2011, ICU was held from 14-16 November in Hotel Manhattan Jakarta

profile_positions.description:
I assist NGOs, government, and private sectors to grow their business and to bring more positive impacts to the society focusing on the sustainability & development sectors.

Service: capacity building, research, project design/implementation, project exposure (PR & marketing).

Recent Projects:
1. Australia Awards Grant: Increasing the Productivity of Seaweed through Value Chain Intervention in Sikka, Nusa Tenggara Timur (Jan-Dec 2019)
2. YSEALI Grant: Women Economic Empowerment Project in Bali and Jakarta (Oct-Dec 2019)
3. Strategic Partnership Manager - Nomads Giving Back (July-September 2019)
4. Impact report for ANGIN (Feb- June 2022)

Experience:

1. Project Management: 9+ years in designing, implementing and coordinating projects & programs.
2. Research & Writing: 5 book publications (3 co-authored), 2 accepted solo grant proposals each by USAID & AUSAID, and significant contributions for grant proposals and field/desktop research activities to diverse clients.
3. Event Organizing: 12+ years in organizing social & environmental impact projects.
4. Public Speaking: 10 + years in public speaking as a speaker, MC, and moderator.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Working with an impact tech startup focusing on global plastic recycling. I am in charge of developing community programs across Indonesia under close coordination with a global team in Canada, Brazil, Philipines & Egypt.

Design and implement community programs needed by over 12.000 plastic collectors in 12 provinces of Indonesia through gamification models (data-driven execution) to increase retention and gain new collectors. Result:

1. Rice Exchange program: 20 tons distributed
2. Insurance(BPJS Kes) :  > 1500 collectors  and their family covered
3. Social Welfare (BPJS Ket): > 1500 collectors covered
4. Mobile phone subsidy: > 500 new smartphones distributed 
5. Internet data programs >50k GB data distributed to junkyard owners
6. Bank account programs: >400 unbanked received their bank account
7. Water filters: 25 water filters distributed
8. Tablets for school children: 1850 tablets distributed
9. Scholarship to 25 students, 50 school kits and over 200 schoolbags

Acting Marketing Manager (June 2020- May 2021):
1. Design immediate strategy for marketing, including communication toolkits, branding toolkits, social media publications, video animations, video and photo story materials, printed materials (brochures/posters/flyers, stickers), and branding collateral (banner, T-shirts, tote bags, uniforms, etc)  
2. Create an inbound/outbound Customer Service experience through Whatsapp and SMS platforms, including SOP, FAQ, and schedule.
3. Revive social media of all channels, select & manage external social media agencies for content and posting and align with Plastic Bank Global Canada's vision on content.
4. Coordinate external videographers/photographers for storytelling stories for news publications including choosing sets, interviewees, the shooting process, and storylines.
5. Create and execute a strategy for building a Plastic Bank Facebook Group community for collectors from 0 to 750 (50% of our active collectors in 6 months) with daily content shared.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Community Program Manager

profile_positions.description: Living in Bali Podcast is a podcast that my co-host and I created to assist the transition of people who want to move to Bali as well as to inform audience how to start and run a socially and environmentally conscious business. We managed the interview, stroryline, produce and edit the sound, marketing and brand awareness, shownotes, websites and newsletter. It is available on Spotify, iTunes & Player FM.
profile_positions.title: Cohost & Producer

profile_positions.description: Designed and executed digital marketing strategy across all platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Blog, Mailchimp) and optimized SEO to increase brand awareness and sales traffic/leads.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Communications Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
- Successfully implemented rebranding process of the organisation and its transition from VECO Indonesia to Rikolto Indonesia. 
- Expanding networks and looking for potential partners to work on new projects.
- Developing concept notes and proposals for new programs and projects on interdisciplinary issues such as sustainability, gender balance, and youth empowerment. 
- Piloting the expansion of the seaweed commodity, which is being implemented in NTT and Bali as a new commodity project of the organisation. 
- Integrating and executing Rikolto Belgia's Global Food for The Future Program to Rikolto Indonesia's social entrepreneurship program for youth in Ende, NTT.
profile_positions.title: Communication & Partnership Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Under the ANIP (Australian National University Internship Program) program, I assisted the executive director in doing research on urban infill/urban renewal policy and implementation in Canberra as well as producing reports that are used to educate people and coordinate with the government.
profile_positions.title: Program Associate

profile_positions.description:
During the semester break of my study at ANU, I conducted an internship for Forest Action Nepal (http://forestaction.org/), a Kathmandu-based think tank that focuses on research and policy dialogue for productive, equitable, and sustainable forest and natural resource management. As the work of this institution is closely related to my study at Crawford School of Public Policy ANU, I was able to compare my theoretical learning in the classroom with the real implementation on the ground. Moreover, during my time internship, I managed to conduct several field studies to observe the implementation of Community Based Forest Management in different districts in Nepal. 

I managed to present the findings from my field research in Nepal at ANU Student Research Conference 2015 held on 16 July 2015 and at the 15th Graduate Research Presentation at the University of Hawai'i in Manoa in February 2016.
profile_positions.title: Field Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Under ANU-UGM Research Collaboration on Legislative Election, my work as a field researcher was as follow:

•	Conducting interviews to 30 legislative candidates and their successful team.
•	Conducting behavioral observations (candidate shadowing) to 5 legislative candidates and 5 members of the successful team, with a focus on the interaction of the candidate to their constituents and their campaign style.
•	Collecting data in form of daily report, interview summary, observations report, event report, and shadowing report.
•	Collecting documentation of audio / visual acquired during the research period.
•	Writing mid term reports and final reports based on the interviews and observations.

Within this project, I was able to co-write a book in Indonesian and English as follow:

•	Co-write Chapter 6 “Jakarta: Kesejahteraan Sosial dan Layanan untuk Konsistuen di Kota Metropolis” on a book “Politik Uang di Indonesia: Patronase dan Klientelisme pada Pemilu Legislatif 2014” published by PolGov UGM in January 2015 
•	Co write “Electoral Dynamics in Indonesia: Money Politics, Patronage and Clientelism at the Grassroots” published by National University of Singapore in March 2016
profile_positions.title: Field Researcher

profile_positions.description: I initiated and implemented an intensive training for young potential entrepreneur in Indonesia on sustainable and environmental friendly business.YEP Ecopreneurship camp aims to address two main issues in Indonesia: youth unemployment and environment awareness. More information www.yepcamp.org

profile_positions.description: Assisting the C4J Judicial Training Expert and the Prosecutorial Team in designing, developing and implementing training for courts, prosecutors’ offices, and communities on the topic of biodiveristy law in compliance with USAID regulations and the contract signed by USAID and Chemonics.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.role: #eMpoweringYouths program with Maybank in Bangkok and Gombak (Malaysia)
volunteer_experiences.description:
I am one among 100 selected participants for #eMpoweringYouths where youth across #Asean countries received training on #communitydevelopment in Thailand and then deployed for 2 weeks in Indonesia Malaysia and Cambodia, to do volunteering on Environment, Arts & Culture, and Education. I was assigned to volunteer for Ecoknights, a sustainable NGO based in Kuala Lumpur Malaysia for 2 weeks.

I am deeply honoured to be selected to contribute more to Asean integration, promote volunteerism, multinationalism and people to people diplomacy.
I assisted new students to become familiar with ANU and to make their transition to university life a smooth one.

AYPVC is a regional volunteering programme initiated by the Brunei government in conjunction with the ASEAN Chairmanship in 2013. The programme aims to continue bringing together youth and young professionals from all over ASEAN together in a platform to support local communities with skills transfer and service delivery. I was in Hue, Vietnam, with 23 other fellow volunteers from 10 different ASEAN nations delivering environmental workshop, building school construction and cooking my national dishes for other fellow volunteers and local people.

Bansko Nomad Fest is a annual event to gather people who have a location independent lifestyle and nomad mindset with over 700+ participants in one week event. My task is to ensure the speakers and the main stage are ready for the event.

I went to Colombia doing internship for environmental campaign in Park Lleras, Medellin, (the 2nd biggest city in Colombia). My work includes social media campaign, face to face campaign, visiting few sites and presentation of environmental activities in Indonesia. The internship was conducted under AIESEC UPB Global Community Development Programme (GCDP) Lets Do It Project.

Indonesian Language Teaching Assistance in Curtin Primary School. I assisted the teacher in preparing the curriculum, assessing students, teaching in class, presentation and exposing Indonesian culture to students (age 5-14)

company.name: ANU Postgraduate and Research Students'​ Association (PARSA)

volunteer_experiences.description:
I volunteered in 2012 as the writer's liaison and in 2019 as an MC.

The Ubud Writers & Readers Festival is Southeast Asia’s leading festival of words and ideas. The Festival celebrates extraordinary stories, amplifies brave voices, and tackles global issues through the lens of literature and the arts.

The Festival brings together a diverse mix of Indonesian and international writers, speakers, thinkers, artists, advocates, commentators and activists, to create a space for cross-cultural dialogue and connection.

On my thrid semester of university, I was appointed as a Project Coordinator for “Workshop Journalism and Seminar Global Warming” held by University of Indonesia Journalism body ‘Fisipers’ in cooperation with BBC Indonesia (August – December 2007)
